questions.question: Solve the following system of inequalities graphically: $4x + 3y \le 60, y \ge 2x, x \ge 3, x, y \ge 0$.
questions.solution:
1. **Lines**: Draw $4x + 3y = 60$ (passes through (15,0), (0,20)), $y = 2x$ (passes through (0,0), (5,10)), and $x = 3$.
2. **Shading**:
- $4x + 3y \le 60$: Region below the line.
- $y \ge 2x$: Region above/left of the line.
- $x \ge 3$: Region to the right of $x=3$.
3. **Intersection Points**:
- $y=2x$ and $x=3$: Point A(3, 6).
- $4x+3y=60$ and $y=2x$: $4x+6x=60 \implies 10x=60 \implies x=6, y=12$. Point B(6, 12).
- $4x+3y=60$ and $x=3$: $12+3y=60 \implies 3y=48 \implies y=16$. Point C(3, 16).
The solution is the triangular region ABC.

questions.question: Solve the following system of inequalities graphically: $3x + 2y \le 150, x + 4y \le 80, x \le 15, y \ge 0, x \ge 0$.
questions.solution:
1. **Lines**:
- $3x + 2y = 150$: Intercepts (50, 0), (0, 75).
- $x + 4y = 80$: Intercepts (80, 0), (0, 20).
- $x = 15$: Vertical line.
2. **Shading**: Below both lines and left of $x=15$.
3. **Intersection Points**:
- $x=15$ and $x+4y=80$: $15+4y=80 \implies 4y=65 \implies y=16.25$. Point (15, 16.25).
- $x+4y=80$ and y-axis: (0, 20).
- $x=15$ and x-axis: (15, 0).
- Origin: (0, 0).
Note: Intersection of $3x+2y=150$ and $x+4y=80$ is at $x=44$, which is $>15$, so it's outside the feasible region.
questions.diagram: <svg viewBox='0 0 300 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><defs><marker id='arrow' markerWidth='10' markerHeight='10' refX='9' refY='3' orient='auto' markerUnits='strokeWidth'><path d='M0,0 L0,6 L9,3 z' fill='#000' /></marker></defs><line x1='20' y1='280' x2='280' y2='280' stroke='#000' stroke-width='2' marker-end='url(#arrow)' /><line x1='20' y1='280' x2='20' y2='20' stroke='#000' stroke-width='2' marker-end='url(#arrow)' /><text x='270' y='295'>X</text><text x='10' y='20'>Y</text><line x1='20' y1='280' x2='220' y2='30' stroke='#555' stroke-width='1' stroke-dasharray='4' /><text x='200' y='40' font-size='10'>3x+2y=150</text><line x1='20' y1='200' x2='280' y2='280' stroke='#555' stroke-width='1' /><text x='20' y='190' font-size='10'>x+4y=80</text><line x1='80' y1='280' x2='80' y2='20' stroke='#555' stroke-width='1' /><text x='80' y='295' font-size='10'>x=15</text><polygon points='20,280 80,280 80,215 20,200' fill='rgba(0, 0, 255, 0.2)' stroke='blue' stroke-width='2' /><circle cx='20' cy='280' r='3' fill='red' /><circle cx='80' cy='280' r='3' fill='red' /><circle cx='80' cy='215' r='3' fill='red' /><text x='85' y='215' font-size='10'>(15, 16.25)</text><circle cx='20' cy='200' r='3' fill='red' /><text x='25' y='195' font-size='10'>(0, 20)</text></svg>

questions.question: Solve the following system of inequalities graphically: $x + 2y \le 10, x + y \ge 1, x - y \le 0, x \ge 0, y \ge 0$.
questions.solution:
1. **Lines**:
- $x + 2y = 10$: (10,0), (0,5).
- $x + y = 1$: (1,0), (0,1).
- $x = y$: Line through origin.
2. **Shading**:
- $x + 2y \le 10$: Below.
- $x + y \ge 1$: Above.
- $x \le y$: Above/Left of $y=x$.
3. **Intersection Points**:
- $x=y$ and $x+2y=10$: $3x=10 \implies x=10/3$. Point (3.33, 3.33).
- $x=y$ and $x+y=1$: $2x=1 \implies x=0.5$. Point (0.5, 0.5).
- Y-axis intersections: (0, 1) and (0, 5).
questions.diagram: <svg viewBox='0 0 300 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><defs><marker id='arrow' markerWidth='10' markerHeight='10' refX='9' refY='3' orient='auto' markerUnits='strokeWidth'><path d='M0,0 L0,6 L9,3 z' fill='#000' /></marker></defs><line x1='20' y1='280' x2='280' y2='280' stroke='#000' stroke-width='2' marker-end='url(#arrow)' /><line x1='20' y1='280' x2='20' y2='20' stroke='#000' stroke-width='2' marker-end='url(#arrow)' /><text x='270' y='295'>X</text><text x='10' y='20'>Y</text><line x1='20' y1='130' x2='270' y2='280' stroke='#555' stroke-width='1' /><text x='20' y='120' font-size='10'>x+2y=10</text><line x1='20' y1='250' x2='50' y2='280' stroke='#555' stroke-width='1' /><text x='10' y='245' font-size='10'>x+y=1</text><line x1='20' y1='280' x2='280' y2='20' stroke='#555' stroke-width='1' /><text x='260' y='30' font-size='10'>y=x</text><polygon points='20,250 35,265 120,180 20,130' fill='rgba(255, 165, 0, 0.3)' stroke='orange' stroke-width='2' /><circle cx='20' cy='250' r='3' fill='red' /><text x='25' y='250' font-size='10'>(0,1)</text><circle cx='20' cy='130' r='3' fill='red' /><text x='25' y='130' font-size='10'>(0,5)</text><circle cx='120' cy='180' r='3' fill='red' /><text x='125' y='180' font-size='10'>(3.3,3.3)</text><circle cx='35' cy='265' r='3' fill='red' /><text x='40' y='270' font-size='10'>(0.5,0.5)</text></svg>

questions.question: Solve the following system of inequalities graphically: $2x + y \ge 4, x + y \le 3, 2x - 3y \le 6$.
questions.solution:
1. **Lines**:
- $2x + y = 4$: (2,0), (0,4).
- $x + y = 3$: (3,0), (0,3).
- $2x - 3y = 6$: (3,0), (0,-2).
2. **Shading**:
- $2x + y \ge 4$: Above/Right.
- $x + y \le 3$: Below/Left.
- $2x - 3y \le 6$: Above/Left.
3. **Intersection Points**:
- $2x+y=4$ and $x+y=3$: Subtracting gives $x=1, y=2$. Point (1, 2).
- $x+y=3$ and $2x-3y=6$: At y=0, x=3. Point (3, 0).
- $2x+y=4$ and $2x-3y=6$: Subtracting gives $4y=-2 \implies y=-0.5, x=2.25$. Point (2.25, -0.5).
questions.diagram: <svg viewBox='0 0 300 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><defs><marker id='arrow' markerWidth='10' markerHeight='10' refX='9' refY='3' orient='auto' markerUnits='strokeWidth'><path d='M0,0 L0,6 L9,3 z' fill='#000' /></marker></defs><line x1='20' y1='150' x2='280' y2='150' stroke='#000' stroke-width='2' marker-end='url(#arrow)' /><line x1='100' y1='280' x2='100' y2='20' stroke='#000' stroke-width='2' marker-end='url(#arrow)' /><text x='270' y='165'>X</text><text x='90' y='20'>Y</text><line x1='60' y1='230' x2='140' y2='70' stroke='#555' stroke-width='1' /><text x='60' y='245' font-size='10'>2x+y=4</text><line x1='60' y1='190' x2='220' y2='30' stroke='#555' stroke-width='1' /><text x='200' y='40' font-size='10'>x+y=3</text><line x1='60' y1='123' x2='220' y2='230' stroke='#555' stroke-width='1' /><text x='200' y='240' font-size='10'>2x-3y=6</text><polygon points='140,70 220,150 190,170' fill='rgba(128, 0, 128, 0.3)' stroke='purple' stroke-width='2' /><circle cx='140' cy='70' r='3' fill='red' /><text x='145' y='70' font-size='10'>(1,2)</text><circle cx='220' cy='150' r='3' fill='red' /><text x='225' y='145' font-size='10'>(3,0)</text><circle cx='190' cy='170' r='3' fill='red' /><text x='195' y='175' font-size='10'>(2.25,-0.5)</text></svg>

questions.question: Solve the following system of inequalities graphically: $x - 2y \le 3, 3x + 4y \ge 12, x \ge 0, y \ge 1$.
questions.solution:
1. **Lines**:
- $x - 2y = 3$: (3,0), (0,-1.5).
- $3x + 4y = 12$: (4,0), (0,3).
- $y = 1$: Horizontal line.
2. **Shading**:
- $y \ge 1$: Above $y=1$.
- $3x + 4y \ge 12$: Above/Right.
- $x - 2y \le 3$: Above/Left.
3. **Intersection Points**:
- $y=1$ and $3x+4y=12$: $3x+4=12 \implies 3x=8 \implies x=2.67$. Point (2.67, 1).
- $y=1$ and $x-2y=3$: $x-2=3 \implies x=5$. Point (5, 1).
The region is unbounded, lying between the two lines above $y=1$.
questions.diagram: <svg viewBox='0 0 300 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><defs><marker id='arrow' markerWidth='10' markerHeight='10' refX='9' refY='3' orient='auto' markerUnits='strokeWidth'><path d='M0,0 L0,6 L9,3 z' fill='#000' /></marker></defs><line x1='20' y1='280' x2='280' y2='280' stroke='#000' stroke-width='2' marker-end='url(#arrow)' /><line x1='20' y1='280' x2='20' y2='20' stroke='#000' stroke-width='2' marker-end='url(#arrow)' /><text x='270' y='295'>X</text><text x='10' y='20'>Y</text><line x1='20' y1='240' x2='280' y2='240' stroke='#555' stroke-width='1' /><text x='260' y='235' font-size='10'>y=1</text><line x1='20' y1='160' x2='180' y2='280' stroke='#555' stroke-width='1' /><text x='20' y='150' font-size='10'>3x+4y=12</text><line x1='100' y1='280' x2='260' y2='200' stroke='#555' stroke-width='1' /><text x='240' y='210' font-size='10'>x-2y=3</text><polygon points='126,240 220,240 280,210 280,20 100,20' fill='rgba(0, 128, 128, 0.2)' stroke='teal' stroke-width='2' stroke-dasharray='5,5' /><circle cx='126' cy='240' r='3' fill='red' /><text x='120' y='255' font-size='10'>(2.67,1)</text><circle cx='220' cy='240' r='3' fill='red' /><text x='220' y='255' font-size='10'>(5,1)</text></svg>

questions.question: Solve the following system of inequalities graphically: $x + y \le 9, y > x, x \ge 0$.
questions.solution:
1. **Lines**:
- $x + y = 9$: (9,0), (0,9).
- $y = x$: Line through origin.
2. **Shading**:
- $x + y \le 9$: Below.
- $y > x$: Above/Left of $y=x$ (dotted line).
- $x \ge 0$: Right of Y-axis.
3. **Intersection Points**:
- $y=x$ and $x+y=9$: $2x=9 \implies x=4.5$. Point (4.5, 4.5).
- Y-axis intercepts: (0, 0) and (0, 9).
The solution is the triangle formed by these points.
questions.diagram: <svg viewBox='0 0 300 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><defs><marker id='arrow' markerWidth='10' markerHeight='10' refX='9' refY='3' orient='auto' markerUnits='strokeWidth'><path d='M0,0 L0,6 L9,3 z' fill='#000' /></marker></defs><line x1='20' y1='280' x2='280' y2='280' stroke='#000' stroke-width='2' marker-end='url(#arrow)' /><line x1='20' y1='280' x2='20' y2='20' stroke='#000' stroke-width='2' marker-end='url(#arrow)' /><text x='270' y='295'>X</text><text x='10' y='20'>Y</text><line x1='20' y1='20' x2='280' y2='280' stroke='#555' stroke-width='1' /><text x='20' y='30' font-size='10'>x+y=9</text><line x1='20' y1='280' x2='280' y2='20' stroke='#555' stroke-width='1' stroke-dasharray='4' /><text x='260' y='30' font-size='10'>y=x</text><polygon points='20,280 150,150 20,20' fill='rgba(255, 0, 255, 0.2)' stroke='magenta' stroke-width='2' /><circle cx='20' cy='280' r='3' fill='red' /><text x='25' y='275' font-size='10'>(0,0)</text><circle cx='20' cy='20' r='3' fill='red' /><text x='25' y='30' font-size='10'>(0,9)</text><circle cx='150' cy='150' r='3' fill='red' /><text x='155' y='150' font-size='10'>(4.5,4.5)</text></svg>
